# numberOfItems(in:)

**Instance Method**

Returns the number of items that the data source manages for the combo box.

## Declaration

```swift
@MainActor optional func numberOfItems(in comboBox: NSComboBox) -> Int
```

## Parameters

- **comboBox**: The combo box.

## Return Value

The number of items that the data source object manages for the specified combo box.

## Discussion

An `NSComboBox` object uses this method to determine how many items it should display in its pop-up list.



## Instance Methods

- **comboBox(_:completedString:)**: Returns the first item from the pop-up list that starts with the text the user has typed.
- **comboBox(_:indexOfItemWithStringValue:)**: Returns the index of the combo box item matching the specified string.
- **comboBox(_:objectValueForItemAt:)**: Returns the object that corresponds to the item at the specified index in the combo box.
